craj

Class PerfectCircleCoordinates

  • java.lang.Object
    • craj.PerfectCircleCoordinates

  • public class PerfectCircleCoordinates
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the pixel data of a perfect circle which is used to draw circles in the resulting cross count and cross value tables and increase the performance because the calculation of the circle pixels in its origin space is already done and does not have to be calculated every time a circle is drawn.
    Author:
    Alexander Johr u26865 m18927, Caroline Rühling u26864 m18926

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PerfectCircleCoordinates.DifferenceFromOrigin
      This class holds the difference of the x and y coordinates of pixel data regarding its given origin.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PerfectCircleCoordinates(ShortProcessor circle, boolean verbose)
      Create a PerfectCircleCoordinates object from a ShortProcessor in which the circle was drawn.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<PerfectCircleCoordinates.DifferenceFromOrigin> getEdgeDifferencesFromCircleOrigin()
      Returns the edges pixel data around the origin.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.Byte,java.lang.Byte> getInnerCircleLineBounds()
      Returns a map of the y coordinate and the corresponding right bound of that y coordinate from the origin of the circle.
